definition.para: Date the original resource was created.

instructions.para: Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.

example.para: If the Date field = "1940," Date EDTF = "1940"
If the Date field = "ca. 1910," Date EDTF = "1915/1920"

admin.para: Instructions need to be completed. At the very least a reference to EDTF needs to be entered.

For the xsd, datatype is xs:string; the datatype is more accurately http://id.loc.gov/datatypes/edtf, which is not a valid QName and is inavlis acc to schema-4-properties-0.1, but this does not seem to be machine-actionable; more exploration needed.

generalNotes.para: EDTF is still a standard in progress. It has not yet been accpted as a full recommendation.

history.justification: Wanted to add standardized date forms (EDTF) required by Orbis Cascade Dublin Core Best Practices (https://www.orbiscascade.org/dublin-core-best-practices).
